Description: Fragment of lip and wall of Attic red-figured pottery kylix with offset lip. Inside glazed; outside, in handle zone, upper part of youth in himation, facing left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 108, no. 384, pl. 81)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1741)
